column9:
This table shows the Spring 2024 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It reflects instructional activity at both undergraduate and graduate levels, with totals converted into standardized FTEs.

By School (Spring 2024):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest school, generating 46,720 credit hours, equal to about 3,149 FTEs.

Business – produced 13,080 credit hours, translating into 898 FTEs.

Education – contributed 5,437 credit hours, for 411 FTEs.

Health & Rehabilitation Sciences – generated 7,931 credit hours, supporting 559 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – the second-largest unit, with 32,482 credit hours, equal to 2,213 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – instructional load at each level.

Total Credit Hours – combined UG and GR hours.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollments (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
